intro: Oxytheca spergulina, commonly known as the narrowleaf oxytheca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture that aids in water conservation. Oxytheca spergulina is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid conditions.
